Field.label: subhalo concentration
Field.description: NFW concentration parameter of the dark matter subhalo in which this galaxy resides. In the case of type 2 satellites, this corresponds to the concentration its subhalo had before disappearing from the subhalo catalogs.

Field.label: id_galaxy_sky
Field.description: unique ID in the mock sky

Field.label: id_group_sky
Field.description: unique group ID in the mock sky

Field.label: bulge specific angular momentum
Field.description: specific angular momentum of the bulge

Field.label: disk specific angular momentum
Field.description: specific angular momentum of the disk

Field.label: l (x)
Field.description: X component of the total angular momentum of the galaxy. In the case of type 2 galaxies, the AM vector is randomly oriented.

Field.label: l (y)
Field.description: Y component of the total angular momentum of the galaxy. In the case of type 2 galaxies, the AM vector is randomly oriented.

Field.label: l (z)
Field.description: Z component of the total angular momentum of the galaxy. In the case of type 2 galaxies, the AM vector is randomly oriented.

Field.label: bulge atomic gas mass
Field.description: atomic gas mass (helium plus hydrogen) in the bulge

Field.label: disk atomic gas mass
Field.description: atomic gas mass (helium plus hydrogen) in the disk

Field.label: disk gas mass
Field.description: total gas mass in the disk

Field.label: bulge molecular gas mass
Field.description: molecular gas mass (helium plus hydrogen) in the bulge

Field.label: disk molecular gas mass
Field.description: molecular gas mass (helium plus hydrogen) in the disk

Field.label: host halo mvir
Field.description: Dark matter mass of the host halo in which this galaxy resides

Field.label: subhalo mvir
Field.description: Dark matter mass of the subhalo in which this galaxy resides. In the case of type 2 satellites, this corresponds to the mass its subhalo had before disappearing from the subhalo catalogs.

Field.label: intrinsic half-mass radius of bulge gas
Field.description: intrinsic half-mass radius of gas in the bulge

Field.label: apparent half-mass radius of bulge gas
Field.description: apparent semi-major axis of half-mass ellipse of gas in the bulge

Field.label: intrinsic half-mass radius of disk gas
Field.description: intrinsic half-mass radius of gas in the disk

Field.label: apparent half-mass radius of disk gas
Field.description: apparent semi-major axis of half-mass ellipse of gas in the disk

Field.label: intrinsic half-mass radius of bulge stars
Field.description: intrinsic half-mass radius of stars in the bulge

Field.label: apparent half-mass radius of bulge stars
Field.description: apparent semi-major axis of half-mass ellipse of stars in the bulge

Field.label: intrinsic half-mass radius of disk stars
Field.description: intrinsic half-mass radius of stars in the disk

Field.label: apparent half-mass radius of disk stars
Field.description: apparent semi-major axis of half-mass ellipse of stars in the disk

Field.label: hi flux (21 cm)
Field.description: 21 cm HI flux from atomic hydrogen in the galaxy

Field.label: bulge sfr
Field.description: total star formation rate taking place in bulges in the simulated box

Field.label: disk sfr
Field.description: star formation rate in the disk

Field.label: galaxy type
Field.description: galaxy type; 0 for centrals; 1 for satellites that reside in well identified subhalos; 2 for orphan satellites

Field.label: host halo vvir
Field.description: Virial velocity of the dark matter host halo in which this galaxy resides.

Field.label: subhalo vvir
Field.description: Virial velocity of the dark matter subhalo in which this galaxy resides. In the case of type 2 satellites, this corresponds to the virial velocity its subhalo had before disappearing from the subhalo catalogs.

Field.label: bulge gas metallicity
Field.description: metallicity of the gas in the bulge

Field.label: disk gas metallicity
Field.description: metallicity of the gas in the disk

Field.label: position angle
Field.description: position angle from North to East
